episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of topics including the infamous Scottish poet William McGonagall, the massive consumption of hazelnuts by Ferrero products, the history and evolution of sofas, and the first advertisement aired on Channel 5.

facts.fact: Scottish poet William McGonagall's writing was so bad, a circus hired him to give poetry readings under the condition that audiences could pelton with eggs as he read.
One third of all the hazelnuts in the world go into Ferrero products.
The earliest depicted sofas were five feet high off the ground.
The first advert to be shown on Channel 5 was for Chanel No. 5.
